    • solveProblem

      public int solveProblem()
      Description copied from class: Drafter
      Perform the necessary steps to solve your problem.

      In the execution pipeline, this occurs after commands are specified and validated. Use this section to perform the main computations necessary to run your program.

      Specified by:
      solveProblem in class Drafter
      Returns:
      an integer return code marking the exit status of your program. 0 = success, anything else marks failure.

    • setCommands

      public Command[] setCommands()
      Description copied from class: Drafter
      Construct a set of command-arguments that the user must enter to run the program.

      In the execution pipeline, this occurs before commands are validated and before the solveProblem command begins. Use this section to define the parameters of the problem in terms of what the user interacts with. See the *Command classes for more details.

      Specified by:
      setCommands in class Drafter
      Returns:
      an array of commands representing what the user must interact with

    • actOnCommands

      public void actOnCommands()
      Description copied from class: Drafter
      Post-process commands.

      In the execution pipeline, this occurs after the user commands have validated, but before the solveProblem command begins. Use this section to sanity check your inputs and variables, to assert that files exist, etc.

      Specified by:
      actOnCommands in class Drafter
